rev.diff:
Line 1: Line 1:
[[File:Google Nexus.svg|thumb|Logo of Nexus]]
[[File:Google Nexus.svg|thumb|Logo of Nexus]]
  +
[[File:Galaxy Nexus.png|200px|thumb|[[Galaxy Nexus]], the latest in the Nexus family]]
The '''Nexus''', '''Nexus brand''' or '''Nexus family''' is a series of [[Android (operating system)|Android]] smartphones produced by [[Google]] in co-operation with selected hardware companies. The purpose of the Nexus phones is to offer a "pure Android experience", where the phones come free of carrier or manufacturer modifications and with an unlockable bootloader<ref>http://android-developers.blogspot.com/2010/12/its-not-rooting-its-openness.html</ref> to allow for further development and end-user modification.<ref>http://www.engadget.com/2011/11/03/galaxy-nexus-gets-rooted-forums-burst-into-applause/</ref> Nexus phones are considered the "flagship" Android devices.<ref>http://lifehacker.com/5707214/google-launches-android-23-gingerbread-and-nexus-s-flagship-phone</ref><ref>http://gizmodo.com/5851133/samsung-galaxy-nexus-the-greatest-androids-got-a-720p-super-amoled-display</ref><ref>http://www.zdnet.com/blog/mobile-news/dont-diss-my-phone-nexus-s-to-get-ice-cream-sandwich-within-weeks/5214</ref><ref>http://www.engadget.com/2010/11/11/exclusive-samsung-flagship-phone-with-gingerbread-and-huge-di/</ref><ref>http://www.gottabemobile.com/2011/07/21/nexus-s-on-its-way-to-att-too-late-to-matter/</ref>
The '''Nexus''', '''Nexus brand''' or '''Nexus family''' is a series of [[Android (operating system)|Android]] smartphones produced by [[Google]] in co-operation with selected hardware companies. The purpose of the Nexus phones is to offer a "pure Android experience", where the phones come free of carrier or manufacturer modifications and with an unlockable bootloader<ref>http://android-developers.blogspot.com/2010/12/its-not-rooting-its-openness.html</ref> to allow for further development and end-user modification.<ref>http://www.engadget.com/2011/11/03/galaxy-nexus-gets-rooted-forums-burst-into-applause/</ref> Nexus phones are considered the "flagship" Android devices.<ref>http://lifehacker.com/5707214/google-launches-android-23-gingerbread-and-nexus-s-flagship-phone</ref><ref>http://gizmodo.com/5851133/samsung-galaxy-nexus-the-greatest-androids-got-a-720p-super-amoled-display</ref><ref>http://www.zdnet.com/blog/mobile-news/dont-diss-my-phone-nexus-s-to-get-ice-cream-sandwich-within-weeks/5214</ref><ref>http://www.engadget.com/2010/11/11/exclusive-samsung-flagship-phone-with-gingerbread-and-huge-di/</ref><ref>http://www.gottabemobile.com/2011/07/21/nexus-s-on-its-way-to-att-too-late-to-matter/</ref>
